Frequently Asked Questions

  • All iPhone 12 and iPhone 12 Pro models are 5G capable. For 5G access, you need to activate your iPhone with a carrier that offers 5G service. Some carriers may also require a 5G service plan or a new SIM. Contact your carrier for more information. To learn more, visit https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039.

  • AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, and Verizon are the national wireless carriers for iPhone in the United States, and they all offer 5G service. Apple.com and the Apple Store sell iPhone models for use on these networks.

    View the AT&T 5G coverage map

    View the Sprint 5G coverage map

  • âSIM-freeâ means your iPhone doesnât ship with a carrier nano-SIM. The SIM-free iPhone sold on apple.com and at the Apple Store is unlocked. That means you can use a nano-SIM or eSIM from any carrier that provides service for iPhone.*

    * Use of eSIM requires a wireless service plan (which may include restrictions on switching service providers and roaming, even after contract expiration). Not all carriers support eSIM. Use of eSIM in iPhone may be disabled when purchased from some carriers. See your carrier for details. To learn more, visit https://support.apple.com/kb/HT209044.

  • eSIM technology allows you to add a cellular plan to your iPhone without using a nano-SIM card. Activating an eSIM will require scanning a valid QR code distributed by a wireless carrier, or signing up for a participating plan through a wireless carrier app.*

    * Use of eSIM requires a wireless service plan (which may include restrictions on switching service providers and roaming, even after contract expiration). Not all carriers support eSIM. Use of eSIM in iPhone may be disabled when purchased from some carriers. See your carrier for details. To learn more, visit https://support.apple.com/kb/HT209044.

  • Carrier-connected models of iPhone purchased from Apple come with a physical nano-SIM, which will be used to activate your wireless account. To activate the eSIM on your new iPhone, please contact your carrier once you receive it.*

    * Use of eSIM requires a wireless service plan (which may include restrictions on switching service providers and roaming, even after contract expiration). Not all carriers support eSIM. Use of eSIM in iPhone may be disabled when purchased from some carriers. See your carrier for details. To learn more, visit https://support.apple.com/kb/HT209044.

  • The iPhone models for AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, and Verizon are the same. If you choose to pay with an AT&T Installment plan, your iPhone will be locked to the carrier. For details on network support, please see https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039.

  • If you completed the steps to authorize activation with AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, or Verizon when you purchased your new iPhone online, it will arrive ready to use. Just turn it on and follow the onscreen instructions to set it up and activate with the carrier. If you chose to skip carrier authorization at the time of purchase, youâll need to contact your carrier or visit an Apple Store to enable cellular services.

    You can also set up your iPhone without a nano-SIM using Wi-Fi. You will need an active nano-SIM to enable cellular services. If you selected the SIM-free iPhone, youâll need to insert your own nano-SIM card or obtain one from the supported carrier of your choice and activate it in order to use cellular services on your iPhone. If Sprint is your carrier, youâll need to get a new nano-SIM card in order to activate your iPhone 12 or iPhone 12 Pro.

  • All iPhone models sold on apple.com and at the Apple Store are unlocked, which means they arenât tied to a single carrier, and you can use a SIM from the carrier of your choosing. The exception is when you buy an iPhone with an AT&T Installment Plan. It will be locked to AT&T as the carrier and will only work on the AT&T network for the term of your Installment Plan agreement.

  • You can either pay for your new iPhone in full or pay monthly with Apple Card Monthly Installments, carrier financing, Apple iPhone Payments, or the iPhone Upgrade Program. If you choose an Apple monthly payment option, your carrier service plan will be charged separately. Just choose the option that works for you.

â AppleCare+ provides up to two incidents of accidental damage protection every 12 months. AppleCare+ with Theft and Loss adds up to two incidents of theft or loss coverage every 12 months. Each incident is subject to a service fee or deductible. Taxes may apply. Theft and loss coverage requires you to have Find My iPhone enabled on your device at the time it is lost or stolen. Find My iPhone should remain enabled and your iPhone should remain associated with your Apple ID throughout the theft or loss claim process. Disabling Find My iPhone will void all coverage of theft and loss. You are not required to purchase AppleCare+ with Theft and Loss to participate in the iPhone Upgrade Program.
